instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>,running slow ASD shows VD0R
threads.message:
hi,
have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machine, came in with the "famous" video distortion problem.
so go ahead and replaced the GPU. video back to normal.

then found another issue, it will run very slow , like the sensing circuit problem kind. but the fans don't spin high speed.

so anyway, ran ASD, so error"4SNS/1/40000000:V0DR 19.245

looks like a ppbug g3h sensing?  where should I start?

( the customer kept the battery, it was sent in without the battery there, not sure if that would affect,but I plugged in a service battery with the same result)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>,running slow ASD shows VD0R
threads.message: And yes, it is genuine apple charger that i had been using to fix machine. tried another DC jack as well

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>,running slow ASD shows VD0R
[SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>,running slow ASD shows VD0R
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>, at <CAPACITOR>C5314</CAPACITOR>.
It should be aprox 3V for 18.5V input charger.
If incorrect, measure voltages at <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> pins; some resistor is corroded probably...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>,running slow ASD shows VD0R
threads.message: fixed! it is a broken trace around <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> area, thanks a lot guys!
